data.title: Give it a try
data.text: I really, really like this place. It's a bar, of course, but I have never gone there to drink, so I can't address that aspect of things. It's a little hole-in-the-wall with the odd decor of superheroes and comic books, as well as other miscellaneous items. My biggest complaint, really, is that it's so small. The tables are few and cramped. But I will continue to go there for the food. It's better than typical bar food. The menu is limited, but the sandwiches are great. The onion rings alone are worth the trip. You will not leave hungry, I guarantee it.

data.title: Nice Local Place
data.text: The previous reviews really capture it all.  The sandwich portions are huge and are very tasty.  The draft beer selection is pretty good featuring local brews.  What beats a cold Yuengling, or "larger" as the locals say.  The service is great and the bar has character as well.  I just wish parking was a bit easier.

data.title: Small and cozy
data.text:
Not a big place but the food is fantastic ! Reasonable prices. 
Turkey sub is amazing and half is huge! Full sub is several meals ! Delicious food. Interesting decor. Will return soon as this is your typical hometown bar!

data.title: Comfortable dive bar / Hero Heaven
data.text: Go for the low key, small setting atmosphere and grab a decent beer and meal at a decent price (recommended), or order out one of the enormous heroes.  Like, for back when they used to let you bring food into Veterans Stadium, a "full" hero would feed 4 adults or just Reggie White.  That aside, if the cheesecake is available, you should get it - for yourself or someone who appreciates it because it's one of the best no frills cheesecakes out there.

data.title: Worth Checking For Yourself
data.text: Great food?  Check.  Varied selection?  Check.  Substantial portions?  Check.  Great craft brew selection? Check.  Friendly service?  Check.  OK, it's your turn - check this place out for yourself!

data.title: Very disappointed
data.text: I was disappointed. Several months ago, I made several attempts over several days to call in an order for pick-up. No one ever answered the phone! There was no voicemail or anything. It came across to me as extremely unprofessional.   I had no idea if the business was closed or perhaps changed their number. Their website at the time indicated they did take out orders and I had placed at least a half dozen orders previously.   Turns out, they stopped doing take out orders (the website has been updated since). For some reason, they felt a good way to stop doing take-out orders is to simply not answer the phone when I called. When I finally was frustrated enough to leave a review on Yelp, somebody who worked there posted that they stopped doing take out orders, due to a small kitchen.   I get it, if they're so busy they can't do take out orders, it's great that they're so successful. The way they handled it was poor, and I definitely felt as if they "didn't need" my business. I like their food, but I just have no desire to sit in a small and smokey bar to eat my food. With so many options in Bethlehem, sorry Hometown Heroes, you lost me as a customer.

data.title: Local Favorite
data.text: What a great place to go for over stuffed hero's, one of the best sandwich places in the city. Pauly does a wonderful job making all the sandwiches. Having been there numerous times I did find the sandwiches were not quite as good as when Pauly makes them. The beer selections are adequate to compliment the delicious sandwiches. When ordering if you haven't been there before you might want to only order a half hero as the full size is quite large. Being an order local restaurant it is on the small side and the bathrooms could use some improvements.

data.title: Great NYC style sandwiches!
data.text: Bring your appetite because you'll need it to finish one of these amazing heroes.  This is my favorite place for a big lunch after a morning of activity.  I would recommend this place to anyone who visits or lives in the area.

data.title: Froze my behind off!!
data.text:
Stopped there this past week when it was cold outside and it was as cold inside the place as it was outside. Questioned the waitstaff about turning up the heat and he gave some BS about the thermostat being too close to the grill. When I went to the restroom, the radiator was cold! Turn some freakin' heat on, Pauly! I don't care if it's the middle of the week or not!
Food is still as excellent as usual. Had enough leftovers for the next day.

data.title: Surprise find-
data.text: We were in the area and driving around looking for a local place to eat and found Hometown Heroes.  It is in an old, well kept, working class neighborhood.  I wasn't too sure, but we gave it a try and were happily suprised.  It is a bar restaurant with big, delicious sandwiches.  The half sandwich was as big as a whole one elsewhere.  It even had bruschetta which was excellent. It is a fun place with good food at good prices,

data.title: Best Sandwiches in Town
data.text:
I don't know how I missed this place for so long. Hometown Heroes have the best sandwiches in town, in my opinion. The owner Paul is usually the one behind the grill cooking them up for you too, which adds a nice touch. The beer selection is about average, nothing too fancy there is always a few good selections on tap. Bottled selection is ok as well. 

Overall this is a great place to enjoy a reasonably priced dinner with good company. The 1/2 heroes are the size of a normal sandwich, so don't get too far in over your head.

data.title: Slow
data.text: Very good food, but the service is slow. Get there at noon and have to wait for the fryer to heat up.
